Title: Product Owner
RoleDescription: Job description A Product Owner is the proxy for the customer to one or more Software Engineering teams. Through ownership of the Product Backlog (scope and prioritization) and care for the whole of the product(s), (features, non-functional behaviour, quality, and technical debt), they are responsible for maximizing the value of the product(s) through software engineering work. Building effective relationships with management and stakeholders, in different countries, timezones and cultures, is key to success in this role, as is a high degree of technical expertise to comprehend the complex nature of our products.  Requirement Gathering and Analysis  responsible for:   Learning the product, to ensure proper understanding of context, features and functions   Producing clear, high-quality, specific, and unambiguous, functional and nonfunctional requirements for changes of various complexities   Providing a high-quality detailed analysis with the customer journey in mind, working through requirements in an agile manner, considering for fitness of purpose, adherence to business objectives, and consistency, challenging positively where appropriate.   Defining specific and measurable Acceptance Criteria   The acceptance of those requirements by Software Engineering teams for execution   Collecting feedback and defining requirements from all the involved stakeholders via scheduled and non-scheduled mechanisms   Reviewing and confirming that designed features/functions ultimately meet the specified intent, requirements, business and end-user needs where applicable.   Assessing reported defects, non-functional requirements, and other technical debt, triaging severity and prioritizing resolution alongside feature work, to ensure not only that the product always meets established Quality Criteria, but that quality continuously improves.   Generating documents and other artifacts describing current and future product features and functions, using approved processesPrioritization and Planning  responsible for:   Setting priorities in collaboration with key stakeholders against planned objectives, and supporting sprint planning and other preparatory activities, ensuring that the product needs and vision are maintained.   Tracking progression over time to ensure client, business, and technical goals are met   Coordinating development and defect resolution across multiple teams, programmes and locations, and identifying dependencies between teams   Continuously seeking ways to improve processes to increase efficiency and performance.Working Practices and Relationships:The individual would work with different sets of stakeholders, both technical and business, from Software Engineering Teams to Project/Programme Management, Product Management and Delivery to assist with strategic planning and gain early knowledge of future scope and goals. They would regularly:   Engage with Software Engineering teams and related stakeholders as part of an Agile team, ensuring that Software Engineers understand requirements.   Work with Software Engineering teams to discover underlying design gaps and/or technical gaps against associated risks e.g. security, performance, usability, etc.   Maintain a clear view on progress and articulating it to stakeholders, alongside issues and risks   Confidently facilitate meetings, present and demonstrate software at different levels.   Advocate for Agile practices to achieve increasingly Agile working. Qualifications Experience working in a Product role within a Software / Technology context, possessing strong technical expertise and the ability to confidently work with customers and other stakeholders to establish story acceptance criteria.  Experience of working closely and collaboratively with clients or similar stakeholders to ensure their needs are met, that they receive relevant and timely updates, and managing the product backlog.  Experience of working in an Agile environment, ideally in software product development, using one or more of the primary Agile methodologies (Scrum/KanBan/XP etc).  Fast learner  can quickly get up to speed with vast complex solutions and knows how to acquire knowledge, able to adapt to changes in a fast-paced environment, resilient and self-confident.  Strong networking, collaboration and influencing skills (role requires a hands-on approach to ensure successful delivery).  Excellent written and verbal communication skills (essential to be able to communicate with stakeholders from different countries, cultures, and backgrounds) and strong listening skills.  Able to demonstrate a strong understanding of business processes and translate that understanding into technical requirements.  Being logical and passionate yet patient lends itself to success in this role.  Proven track record in the domain would be an advantage / industry or academic certifications relevant to the domain, technology, or discipline of Product Ownership would be an advantage.Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Title: Senior Finance Manager, Housing - Remote
RoleDescription: Job descriptionWe are looking for a hands-on Senior Finance Manager to be an important partner for the Housing finance team. You will report to the Chief Finance Officer for the EVH Team and work remotely from home in the United States.What you'll doYou will be a critical partner and advisor to the business, providing financial, analytical, and strategic insight on P&L, investments, and complex partner agreements. You will influence decisions on investment strategies for products, identify market drivers for profitability, and support resource allocation.Partner with business departments such as product management and development, sales, marketing, pricing, and service & delivery teams to provide clear insights and visibility to guide revenue and EBIT growth opportunitiesManage the P&L, ensure budgets are achieved, and manage important financial processes for month-end/quarter-end close requirements, annual budget, forecasts, and strategy plan. This includes planning communication such as internal executive meetings, coordination of presentations to executive leadership, and collaboration with all partnersCoordinate acquisition-related finance integration activities helping the business achieve its goalsManage reporting and expertise regarding revenue and cost allocationsUnderstand the details while at the same time being able to advise on big-picture challengesGuide an outside-in perspective by understanding and sharing the market landscape and identifying areas to accelerate business growthDetermine metrics to monitor and review the effectiveness of investments and advise on future spendingDevelop new tools, dashboards, and processes to guide scalable insight. Improve current processes as we integrate the different businesses, looking for opportunities to automate while applying financial discipline and collaborating with partners to deliver the broader CIS business strategyBuild relationships and collaborate across multiple teams to achieve impactful resultsEstablish best practices, embrace and promote a culture that emphasizes accountability, integrity, partnership and transparencyQualificationsBachelor's degree in Finance or related disciplineFamiliarity with Tableau10+ years of related experience in commercial finance, FP&A, or related rolePeople leadership experience and experience communicating analytical findings for a range of different audiencesPromote continuous improvement/process efficiencyExperience leading improvement efforts in financeWorking knowledge of GAAP or IFRSBenefits/Perks:Great compensation package and bonus planCore benefits including medical, dental, vision, and matching 401KFlexible work environment, ability to work remote, hybrid or in-officeFlexible time off including volunteer time off, vacation, sick and 12-paid holidaysOur uniqueness is that we celebrate yours.
